sentences.sContent: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.sCn: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.sContent: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.sCn: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.sContent: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.sCn: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.sContent: ...the agency says projections of the number of unemployed people this year range from 210 million to nearly 240 million people...
...Our topic today is about somethings that foreigners nearly always say when they visit Britain...
...nearly two thirds of people interviewed like to make the same choice as me...
...Considering that the government's standards are not nearly ambitious enough...
...Keep the gas tank as nearly full as you can...
...Crying is a nearly universal sign of grief...
...But the price of a college education has nearly doubled in that time...
...when nearly one-quarter of the workforce was unemployed...
...But it actually shouldn't matter to you nearly as much as you think...

trans.tranOther: almost, but not quite or not completely
